702563f-a.text:
West 15th Street, north of Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk, to Surf Ave. A comfort station will be erected under the opening in the Boardwalk.
November 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

702562f-a.text:
West 15th Street at the N.E. corner of Surf Ave. (Coney Island). The house is known as Eileen Villa and was the home of the Tilyou family. In the right background, is a bridge used
the B.M.T. lines.
July s, 1933.
L. Sperr.

Boardwalk. (Coney Island).
July 4, 1936.

706990f-a.folder: Surf Ave. & 15th St. W., Brooklyn, NY

702560f-b.text:
(1)
2940 West 16th Street, at the N.W. corner of Surf Ave., showing the house of Peter Tilyou, who settled in Coney Island in 1865, and erected the Tilyou House which he conducted until 1895. The house which faces Surf Ave., has a West 15th Street number. Partially seen, is the Villa Penna, at the N.E. corner of Surf Ave., which was demolished for the widening of West 15th Street.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing a complete view from Surf Ave.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

702561f-a.text:
West 15th Street, north to Surf Ave., from Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk, showing demolished site; through which West 15th Street will be extended.
January 1924.
P. L. Sperr.
